page.title: 19A VILLAGE'S LIFE AND FUTURE
page.content: Nowadays a village like Yeaveley cannot offer employment to all its residents. The ambitions of town people to move to villages force property prices to rise. These two factors result in youngsters with roots in the village moving away to find jobs and cheaper places to live. This means an increasing need for those who care about the village to play an active part to ensure that it retains its identity and institutions and does not simply become a dormitory area. The incomers from the towns have much to learn from their new neighbours, but those born in the village must also be prepared to recognise the need for change. Time and development do not pass villages by and only by being alert to change can their residents ensure that their destiny and character are maintained.
